tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: *** ** *** ** *** **** **** ********** *** was a gynecologist for my aunt my mom with whose observation me my cousins were born. She will screw you if you are not serious about the medications which might be not Digestable by certain people but that's how docs should be *** *** ** *** ** *** **** ********

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
* *** ********* *** **** *** ** *** ***** Iam associated with her right from 2002.she handled both the deliveries for me.  She will never ever suggest for a chance section unless it's most required. She stays next to manipal so will reach you anytime you need her. You can connect with her so easily. Once u meet her you will feel u are in safe hands. She is treating me for my fibrosis.
I felt so comfortable after meeting her.

tags: None
review:
I took my wife for Gynae related, suspected for a pregnancy. We have been advised to take scans every week or twice in the 'Manipal hospital, old airport road' to wait for baby's heart beat. But finally after a month they have found it as molar pregnancy. They could have found this in the initial first 2 weeks, but they prolonged us for nearly 5 scans(1 month). 
When we gets these reports to another hospital for second opinion, they had told molar pregnancy is seen in the initial scan report but 'why manipal hospital doctor is unable to recognize this'. 
Now due to this delay, my wife's mole turned into tumour and still she undergoes a cancer treament.
If the doctor or radiology person identified this initially, she wouldnt have suffered this bad stage. They would have done D&C initially which wouldnt have allowed this tissue to grow.
I cannot blame the doctor directly, she only verifies the scan report. I would completely blame the radiology person who took the scan and also the carelessness of the doctor reviewed this report

tags: None
review: Horrible!!!! please dont go to her, She has no concern for the pain and feelings of a woman. when i went for a check up to her for fibroid and cyst she felt that i have no value for life in this world because i was divorced. She gave me ********* tablets for the cyst. She thinks we do need treatments are we are unfit for life.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: We are consulting doctor Subha Rani for the past few years, *** ** *** ** *** **** ****** *** ********** ******** *** **********  Doctor gives complete attention to the patient and gives advises based on need to other department. Doctor keeps track of the patient reports and inform if there is anything critical which would help to take immediate action.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Excellent as always. ** ****** **** ** *** ** *** **** ************* ** *** ***** I would highly recommend her to all looking at resolving gynec issues.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Good doctor, needs to explain much more in detail about the concerned medical issue. She is very re-assuring.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Very experienced, very polite. True dr indeed. She was able to get fear out of us. Very understanding. She has been our family doctor since past 10 years

tags: Wait time,
review: It was satisfying experience. Because, she Could really understand the problem, what my mother was going through. With the experience she comes from. Just very happy we are in good hands.

tags: None
review: Does not listen to patient.. she gives some test. Seeing reports gives another test. Doesn't communicate properly. Spends very less time with patient.
